entities.description: Violations related to the use, possession, or trafficking of weapons.
Instances of human trafficking specifically related to commercial sex acts.
The willful killing of one human being by another without negligence.
The killing of a person through gross negligence.
The killing of a perpetrator of a serious crime, typically in self-defense.
The unlawfully seizing and carrying away of a person by force or fraud.
Unlawful sexual activity and usually sexual intercourse carried out forcibly or under threat of injury against a person's will.
Sexual contact involving penetration without consent.
Forced or unwanted sexual act with an object.
Touching or inappropriate contact, particularly with minors.
Taking or attempting to take something of value by force or threat of force.
An attack for the purpose of inflicting severe injury, often with a weapon.
An attack without a weapon resulting in no serious injury.
The unlawful act of causing a person to fear bodily harm through verbal threats or physical actions.
The criminal act of deliberately setting fire to property.
The practice of obtaining something, especially money, through force or threats.
Illegally entering a building with the intention of committing a crime, especially theft.
Secretly stealing from the pocket of another person.
Theft of a purse without force.
The act of stealing goods from a store.
Stealing property from within a building.
Stealing money or goods from machines designed for public use.
Stealing items from within a motor vehicle.
Stealing parts or accessories from a motor vehicle.
Other forms of theft that do not fall under the classified categories.
The theft or attempted theft of a motor vehicle.

relationships.description: Indicates that a law violation is related to a specific type of crime offense.
Shows that the law violation category includes various specific offenses.
Indicates the geographical location where a criminal event occurs.
Indicates that a criminal act involves a specific individual or group.
Shows the relationship between a crime and its impact on a victim.
